meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah managed to outrebound all her opponents.
meanings.sent2: The basketball player was able to outrebound his rival in every match.
meanings.sent3: It was impressive to see how he could outrebound everyone on the court.
meanings.sent4: She seemed to effortlessly outrebound anyone who dared challenge her.
meanings.sent5: The team's strategy to outrebound the other side proved successful.

meanings.definition: To exceed in the number of rebounds.
meanings.sent1: He always aims to outrebound his own record in every game.
meanings.sent2: The player managed to outrebound his previous best by a significant margin.
meanings.sent3: It's like he's on a mission to outrebound every player in the league.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outrebound all others was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The team's goal was to outrebound their opponents by a large margin.

meanings.sent1: The star player always finds a way to outrebound his competitors.
meanings.sent2: She consistently outrebound her teammates during practice.
meanings.sent3: It's almost like a friendly competition to see who can outrebound the most.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outrebound others set him apart as a top player.
meanings.sent5: The team's determination to outrebound their rivals was evident in their performance.
